<!-- source-hash: 0cec1e6d88c56f0abd771b4847cf16a3 -->
A custom runtime exception thrown when an event cannot be found in the OpenFrame external system, providing specific error messaging for event lookup failures.

## Key Components

- **EventNotFoundException** - Runtime exception class that extends `RuntimeException`
- **Constructor** - Single parameterized constructor accepting an error message string

## Usage Example

```java
// Throwing the exception when an event is not found
public Event findEventById(String eventId) {
    Event event = eventRepository.findById(eventId);
    if (event == null) {
        throw new EventNotFoundException("Event with ID " + eventId + " not found");
    }
    return event;
}

// Catching and handling the exception
try {
    Event event = eventService.findEventById("invalid-id");
} catch (EventNotFoundException e) {
    logger.error("Event lookup failed: " + e.getMessage());
    // Handle the missing event scenario
}
```

This exception follows the standard Java exception pattern by extending `RuntimeException`, making it an unchecked exception that doesn't require explicit handling but can be caught when appropriate error handling is needed.
